Description: Body fragment of Attic red-figured pottery krater. Inside glazed; outside, upper body of female in chiton decorated with crosses and himation, right arm raised; diagonal in front of her a spear shaft or thyrsus, presumably held in left hand; to left uncertain remains - arm with bracelet, or drapery.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
W. Kraiker, Die rotfigurigen attischen Vasen (1978) 35,119, pl. 17,119. Heidelberg, Antikenmuseum I52-I77 and I85-I92 have in the past been erroneously known and cited as J52-77 and J85-92.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1070)
